full_summary:
### Invitation to Tender - Stage 1: Niagara Shoreline Protection, Fort Mississauga Historic National Site

**Reference Number:** cb-7865-1031910
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0137/A
**Publication Date:** 2023-08-03
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-08-29T14:00:00

### Overview

Parks Canada is seeking a qualified supplier for Stage 1 of a two-stage selection process for the Niagara Shoreline Protection project at Fort Mississauga Historic National Site. The project involves the construction of approximately 500m of revetment wall and access areas, including the supply and installation of armour stone, rip-rap, gabion stone, and aggregates.

### Instructions to Bidders

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba; bidders must submit their bids via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.
* Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* The only acceptable facsimile for responses to bid solicitations is 1-855-983-1808.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

### Special Instructions to Bidders

This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders responding to this selection process are requested to submit a bid in two stages: Stage One for qualification and Stage Two for financial evaluation. The qualification list will expire 180 days after the start of the tender or upon award of a contract, whichever is earlier.

### Tender Requirements

National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules and regulations set out in the National Park Act. The project is estimated to have a value between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000.

### Enquiries

All enquiries of a technical and contractual nature should be submitted to the Contracting Authority in writing and received no later than five (5) business days prior to the date set for tender closing.

### Important Information

* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages; if any discrepancies are found, please notify the Contracting Officer.
